glossentry.glossdef: Tariff indicates the rate that is defined for a particular service.
A tariff plan is a rate plan defined for the subscriber for a particular service.
Telecom Application Service manages the subscriber features for IMS.
The Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol is a communications protocol that controls communication between Network Elements (NEs) and external devices over an Ethernet interface.
Traffic Detection Function enables rules to be implemented on network traffic in real time.
Threshold is a boundary that distinguishes certain state of affair.
The Timed Events Manager provides a durable, robust and high performance capability for managing the triggering of event processing that must be performed at specific times.
A timestamp is a sequence of characters that identifies the time when an event occurred.
A top-up is the process of adding usage value to a subscriber account.
Transactions Per Second is a measurement process to calculate the total number of transactions that are completed in a second.
A trigger is an event that occurs on a system and starts an evaluation.
